answers.author: Richard Gertson
answers.text:
We use a Case Manager in Mesquite, Texas, to serve as the point of contact from project conception through issuance of the building permit.  The CM is a planner in the Community Development Department.  The process begins with a Pre-Application Meeting where the CM brings together the various disciplines (that form the larger Development Review Team) for an informational session with the applicant.  From that point the approvals are basically sequential: rezoning-site plan-civil-plan review-permit issuance.  Other departments submit their comments to the CM for review and distribution to the applicant via a blog-like project tracking system.  The CM's responsibilities are to ensure a smooth process, consistency in review, and resolution of internal conflicts.  That's the basic idea.

author: Brad Larson
text:
We are reviewing our processes for land development.  Our development community would like to have a "one shop stop".   Currently, our Community Development Dept., does Site Plans, Rezonings, Plats, etc.  and our Building Service Division does building permits, instpections, etc.  
We are interested in having one case manager from Rezoning to inspections.  Are there any communities that currently do this?
title: Case Manager for Site Plans
